summary.para: Indicates that the method will allow a variable number of arguments in its invocation. This class cannot be inherited.

content.para: A parameter array allows the specification of an unknown number of arguments. A parameter array must be the last parameter in a formal parameter list, and it must be a single-dimension array. A parameter array permits arguments to a method to be specified in two ways:

listItem.para: A single expression of a type that is implicitly convertible to the parameter array type. The parameter array functions as a value parameter.
Zero or more arguments where each argument is an expression of a type that is implictly convertible to the type of the parameter array element.

content.para: For more information about using attributes, see [<topic://cpconExtendingMetadataUsingAttributes>].

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ParamArrayAttribute class with default properties.
